intro: Anthactinia walkeri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in its natural habitat. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements. Anthactinia walkeri thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers well-draining soil.
